content.description: The route goes diagonally up to the left. Layback the obvious crack in the main cliff. The crux is probably near the end where the feet get slightly worse (although the whole thing is fairly easy).
content.location: Start in the middle of the main cliff at the very end of the crack. Top out at the top left corner.

content.description: This is a mossy and rather dirty route, but it is actually super fun, because the moves are awesome. The line follows a crack that varies in width and can be laybacked and jammed. To get to this boulder, walk past the main cliff, and scramble up and down boulders until you find a tall slab boulder that is on the right side of the cluster of boulders. The route is on the left face of the boulder.
content.location: Start with both hands in a wider spot at the bottom of the crack, and reach past a thin section to where the crack widens, then follow it to the top.

content.description: This is a fun, easy traverse route. *To find this boulder, walk up the hill and to the right of the main jumble of boulders on the hill. There is a house next to it.
content.protection: None, the landing is good, and it is not high off the ground.
content.location: Start sitting on the rightmost side of the rock. Traverse left along the lip as it gets higher, and move into a juggy crack system until you reach a flake in the middle, then top out.

content.description: Rail Gun is a fun and easy route. It would be good for warming up or just a good time.
content.location: The start is the obvious lowest rail on the left side of the rock. Then from the rail, trend straight up using the rest of the rails to the easy topout.

content.description: This route is extremely hard. It has seen not one ascent. It's quite hard, and if you're looking for a challenge, I would recommend getting on it.
content.location: The start is in the cave just below Hydraulic Press and starts on the bad holds as far down as you can. Your right hand is a sidepull rail thing, and your left hand is a not too great crimper. Go up similarly to Hydraulic Press.

content.description: This climb has some bad holds and is pretty hard for a V4. Give this a couple of goes before the start hold on the left wears your skin down.
content.location: Start on the 2 crimps adjacent to each other, and continue out right. Make sure you go right, because going straight up is a different route. Once you're far right (make sure the pads are in a good spot), make the couple tough moves up to the topout.

content.description: Hydraulic Press is a great route for a compression type climb. This is the variation to the climb that starts lower on the route. It is significantly easier than the lower start and is just as fun.
content.location: This climb starts in the cave, not on the lowest holds but on the decent sidepulls right above them. From the start, just go up using whatever you can to get to the top.

content.description: This is a one move dyno problem that is to the right of Earthquake.
content.protection: At least two pads, the landing isn't great.
content.location: Start with your left hand on a sidepull in the middle of the face (the same starting hold as for Earthquake, except you are to the right of it, so you use it as a sidepull, not a gaston) and your right hand on a crimp above it. Then dyno for the lip, and top out.

content.description: This is a sit start to Earthquake that adds a few tough moves into it.
content.location: Start on 2 sharp sidepulls to the left of the main face on the arete. Bump your hand up to the sidepull jug, and swing around and right to finish as for Earthquake.

content.description: The crux is probably getting off the ground to the first move. It’s a fun dyno problem. It is located in the middle of a bunch of boulders.
content.protection: 2ish pads, the landing is a bit sketchy.
content.location: The start is on a side pull/jug that is on the arete and the right hand is on a Gaston. From there you go up to a crimp, then bump up the left hand, and dyno to the top.

content.description: Behemoth is a fun, short cave route that has a pretty desperate topout. This boulder is located on the right side of the jumble of boulders on the hillside. It is on the underside of a boulder leaning against the farthest right slab.
content.protection: The landing is pretty bad, so try to squeeze a few pads into the cave, and make sure to prop one up on the slab behind it, so you don't hit your head.
content.location: Start with your left hand on a sloper on the arete and your right hand on a sidepull. Get a left heel hook, make a big move to the top, and top out.

content.description: This is a nice area with a few good routes ranging from V1 to V5 (and above.) The quality of the rock is great, and I believe the rock type is granite. This boulder has a few unique climbs and very fun ones too with other small boulders scattered around with other easy routes on them. Overall, this is a good spot to check out.
